text:
Problem 4.2

Making a Profit: More or Less

We have found number lines to be useful in representing patterns among rational numbers. In this problem we will use number lines to represent equality and inequality.

Recall that revenue is the amount of money one makes by selling a product or the amount of money one gets paid for working. Expenses are the amount of money needed to make or sell a product. Profit is the amount of money left from the revenue after you have paid for any expenses that occur in making and selling a product.
